fig.title: Short description in a map
fig.p: The following code sample shows how a short description can be used in a DITA map to provide information about a non-DITA resource. The content of the shortdesc element is used when a link preview to the Web site for the American Birding Association is generated.
fig.codeblock: <map> <title>Enjoying birds</title> ... <topicref href="birds-in-colorado.dita"/> <topicref href="bird-calling.dita"/> <topicref href="https://www.birding.example.com/" format="external" type="html"> <topicmeta> <shortdesc>The American Birding Association is only organization in North America that specifically caters to recreational birders. Its mission is to "inspire all people to enjoy and protect wild birds." </topicmeta> </topicref> ... </map>
